For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Letter] 1833 Feb. 18, Washington, District of Columbia [to] E.A. Fitzgerald, Dresden, Tennessee / William Fitzgerald
bibl.author: Fitzgerald, William
bibl.note: This is a letter dated February 18, 1833 from William Fitzgerald in Washington, D.C. to his wife E.A. Fitzgerald in Dresden, Tennessee

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.p: I am trying to wear away the tedious & heavy hours of night by thinking of Home and all that Home means - Superinduced by the stilness stillness and sadness of night I have thought myself into a most delicious melancholy - I declare I never feel so conscious that I have an immortal soul and feel and know its workings so well as when I am in this mood - a month more by Divine permission and I will once more clasp to my arms more objects which alone bind me to existence. - I am well.
div.closer:
Yr Your Husband
W William Fitzgerald
Free
W William . Fitzgerald
Mrs Misses . E. A. Fitzgerald Dresden Tennessee
City of Washington FEB February 21
